title: Algeria: Construction of New Cement Plants Intended to Meet National Demand
text:
Ghana: GWC Cuts Water Supply to Public Toilet 
Algiers — Prime Minister Abdelmalek Sellal said Thursday in Algiers that new cement plants will be built in several regions of the country in a bid to meet the national growing demand. 
"New cement plants will be built in the provinces of Bechar, Oum El Bouaghi and El Bayadh as part of the Industrial Group of Cement of Algeria (GICA)," the premier said in a written answer to a senator, read on his behalf by Minister of Relations with Parliament, Tahar Khaoua. 
Bechar cement plant production capacity is around 1 million tons per year and Oum El Bouaghi plant produces 2 million tons annually while El Bayadh plant produces 1 million tons per year. 
Moreover, a programme was set up to rise the capacities of Chlef and Ain Kbira cement plants, "which will allow to increase by 4 million 
Tonnes." 
"The current production capacity of the GICA Group is estimated at 11.5 million tons / year," he said, noting that the Group had benefited from a development program to raise production to 20 million tons / year by 2018." 
A substantial part of the demand will be met thanks to the investments planned by private operators, approved by the National Council of Investments, like "projects in the provinces of M'sila and Mascara, with a production capacity of 8 million tons per year." 
Two other projects, proposed by private operators in the province of Biskra were approved, with a production capacity of 6.7 million tons/ year, in addition to projects in Laghouat and Adrar, with capacity production of 2.2 million tons/ year" each. Algeria
